modules.description: Maps a file into memory with customizable parameters such as position, data type, layout, and chunk sizes, enabling efficient access to large datasets. It works with file descriptors, Bigarrays, and integer arrays to handle structured binary data. This is useful for reading and processing large binary files without loading them entirely into memory.

Maps a file into memory using low-level system calls, enabling direct access to file contents without explicit reading. It operates on file descriptors and byte sequences, returning a memory-mapped buffer. This is useful for efficiently processing large files or binary data structures stored on disk.

creates a memory-mapped view of a file, allowing direct access to structured binary data through file descriptors, Bigarrays, and integer arrays. It supports custom layouts, offsets, and chunk sizes for efficient data handling. Operations include reading, writing, and manipulating binary data at specific positions. Examples include parsing large binary logs, accessing serialized data structures, and processing raw image or sensor data.
